name: treatment of waste polypropylene, unsanitary landfill, hyperarid infiltration class (-250mm) | waste polypropylene | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18851/documentation

This dataset represents the activity of waste disposal of 'waste polypropylene' in an unsanitary landfill. Recommended use of this dataset: for PP, which goes to disposal as part of managed communal waste mixture. Inventoried waste consists of fraction: 100% PP.   ;Waste composition (wet, in ppmw): gross heating value 35.16 MJ/kg; net heating value 32.6 MJ/kg; H2O 159000; O na; H 118640; C 711700; S 412.07; N 584.94; P na; B na; Cl 1271; Br 8.3396; F 12.509; I na; Ag na; As 1.4786; Ba 208.49; Cd 29.521; Co 1.4594; Cr 10.841; Cu 35.975; Hg 0.041698; Mn 26.131; Mo na; Ni 0.83396; Pb 19.65; Sb 8.7565; Se 1.6342; Sn 3.3169; V 1918.1; Zn 297.42; Be 0.38909; Sc na; Sr 68.87; Ti 778.19; Tl 0.31127; W na; Si na; Fe 1334.3; Ca 2251.7; Al 155.64; K na; Mg 83.396; Na 1140.4.   ;Share of carbon in initial waste that is biogenic 0%. Share of metals in waste not oxidised and bulk-recyclable (exclude very small or thin parts) Iron: 0%; Alu: 0%; Copper: 0%. Overall degradability of waste during 100 years: 1%. 0.001196 kg waste mass remains in the landfill even after the long term period.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from unsanitary landfill are released to air via landfill gas, air and soil via windblown evaporites, and to groundwater.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents a landfill of 'infiltration class 1 hyperarid'. Landfill site with mean annual temperature (MAT) of 8 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 350 mm/year, and net infiltration of -250 mm/year. Negative infiltration means that leachate flow in landfill is reversed and flows upward to the surface, where waste is evaporated and dissolved solids become solid evaporites. Temperature at site can result in permafrost conditions, which slows down water flow by a factor of (alpha t) 0.999. Total climate adjustments with alpha pt of 0.999. The leachate percolating through the landfill has an average residence time of 15 years.;Reference for climatic parameters: Doka, G., 2018, Inventory parameters for regionalised waste disposal mixes
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This is an inventory for an unsanitary, sub-controlled landfill for municipal solid waste. Ultimate average landfill height is 15 meters. Operation phase duration is 25 years. The total raw landfill gas mass produced in the landfill from this waste is 0.00887 kg. The total CH4 mass in the raw landfill gas is 0.006213 kg. Percentage of landfill gas directly emitted is 100w%. Leachate of the landfill is not treated, but emitted untreated. Leachate flow is upward to the surface due to net negative infiltration. No leachate treatment can be performed. Based on average waste composition and climate data the end of carbonate phase is estimated to be reached 6681 years after waste deposition. Arid conditions at this location prompt formation of evaporites from landfill contents which are partially eroded by wind. It is assumed that 10% of these evaporites are eroded by wind and airborne. Initial decay in the first 100 years of this waste results in a wind erosion rate corresponding to 108.7 g/m2.year and long-term decay corresponds to wind erosion of 29.81 g/m2.year.

exchanges.description: main reference product of this activity
